Feature Name: Administration: Definition of Done Checklist Management
Rule Title: A Definition of done checklist displays checklists for all lanes separated into sections
Scenario Title: Definition of done checklist displays checklists for all lanes separated into sections
Scenario Steps:
Given a card in the <Lane Example> lane of mission control
When the 'definition of done' tab is selected
Then checklists are displayed in sections matching the lane names on the Kanban board 
(for example: Open, Planned, In Progress, For Review, In Testing, Done)
And all the checklist sections except <Lane Example> are greyed out

<Lane Example>
| Open |
| Planned |
| In Progress |
| For Review |
| In Testing |
| Done |

Feature Name: Administration: Definition of Done Checklist Management
Rule Title: A Definition of done checklist tab can be saved
Scenario Title: Definition of done checklist tab can be cancelled
Scenario Steps:
Given a card on mission control Kanban board
When the 'definition of done' tab is selected
And a checkbox is ticked 
And a comment is entered
And the 'Cancel' button is pressed on the 'Details' tab
Then the changes made are not saved

Feature Name: Administration: Definition of Done Checklist Management
Rule Title: A Definition of done checklist tab can be saved
Scenario Title: Definition of done checklist tab can be saved
Scenario Steps:
Given a card on mission control Kanban board
When the 'definition of done' tab is selected
And the DoD is satisfied
And the 'Save' button is pressed on the 'Details' tab
Then the changes made are saved

Feature Name: Administration: Definition of Done Checklist Management

Feature Name: Administration: Definition of Done Checklist Management

Scenario Title: A definition of done is not enforced on a project
Scenario Steps: Then the enforce flag is false on the project.json

Feature Name: Administration: Definition of Done Checklist Management
Rule Title: Definitions of done can be enforced for a project
Scenario Title: A user moves a Work Item back when Checklists are enforced
Scenario Steps:
Given a DoD checklist exists for the previous Workstate
And checklists are enforced
When a user moves the Work Item back (left) one more Workstates
Then the Work Item is moved back
Work Item Title: [Kanban] Enforce checklists when moving Work Items between work states

Feature Name: Administration: Definition of Done Checklist Management
Rule Title: Definitions of done can be enforced for a project
Scenario Title: Checklist enforcement prevents a user moving moving an finished card to the right
Scenario Steps:
Given a DoD checklist exists for the current Workstate
And checklists are enforced
And the Checklist items are satisfied
When a user moves the Work Item to the next Workstate
Then the Work Item is successfully moved to the next Workstate

Feature Name: Administration: Definition of Done Checklist Management
Rule Title: Definitions of done can be enforced for a project
Scenario Title: Checklist enforcement prevents a user moving moving an unfinished card to the right
Scenario Steps:
Given a DoD checklist exists for the current Workstate
And checklists are enforced
And the Work Item has unsatisfied list items
When a user attempts to move the Work Item to the next Workstate
Then an error is shown
And the card remains in the current Workstate
Work Item Title: [Kanban] Preventing drag and drop (forward) when Definition Of Done is not met

Feature Name: Administration: Definition of Done Checklist Management

Feature Description:
_As a Mission Control Administrator_
_I want to manage project Sprints_
_So that project work can be tracked over multiple Sprints_

add sprints to a project
5pts
Rule Title: Sprint dates can be selected
Scenario Title: Sprint End date is adjusted to 10 working days after Sprint Start
Scenario Steps:
Given a Sprint Edit modal window
When a Sprint Start date is selected
Then the Sprint End date is adjusted to be 10 working days later

Notes: The system does not account for public holidays, only weekends

Example:
| Start Date | End Date |
| 09/11/2020 | 20/11/2020 |
|  01/01/2021 | 14/01/2021 |
| 29/02/2020 |  13/03/2020 |
| 30/01/2021 |  12/02/2021 |
| 19/02/2024 |  04/03/2024 | (leap year check)
Work Item Title: [Administration] Sprint dates calendar end date jumps to x-days after start date

Feature Description:
_As a Mission Control Administrator_
_I want to manage users' roles and project visibility_
_So that they have the correct access to projects and Mission Control features_
Rule Title: A User can be assigned to Projects
Scenario Title: A User joins a Project
Scenario Steps:
Given a new User has been added to the system
And an Administrator finds [new User] from the Administration > Users pane
And presses the user's Project Roles button
When the Administrator assigns User for [Project]
And presses Save
Then the user will be able to access User features for [Project]

Feature Description:
_As a Mission Control Administrator_
_I want to manage users' roles and project visibility_
_So that they have the correct access to projects and Mission Control features_
Rule Title: A User can be assigned a Role for a Project
Scenario Title: A user is assigned a role within a Project
Scenario Steps:
Given a user account
And the user is assigned a role within a Project
Then the user will have access according to their role

Examples:

| Section    | User | Reviewer  | Stakeholder | Administrator |
| :--        | :--  | :--       | :--         | :--           |
| Base       | Full | Full      | Full        | Full          |
| Briefing   | Full | Read only | Full        | Full          |
| Blast Off! | Full | Read only | Read only   | Full          |
| Launchpad  | Full | None      | Full        | Full          |
| Mission    | Full | Read only | Read only   | Full          |
| Re-entry   | Full | None      | None        | Full          |
| Touchdown  | Full | Full      | Full        | Full          |
| Administration | None | None | None | Full |
| Diagnostics | None | None | None | Read only |
Work Item Title: Users switching projects can still see areas 'restricted' by their account

| Blast Off! | Full | Read only | Read only   | Full          |
| Launchpad  | Full | None      | Full        | Full          |
| Mission    | Full | Read only | Read only   | Full          |
| Re-entry   | Full | None      | None        | Full          |
| Touchdown  | Full | Full      | Full        | Full          |
| Administration | None | None | None | Full |
| Diagnostics | None | None | None | Read only |
Work Item Title: [Reviewers | Stakeholders] Read-only access for Mission, Briefing and Blast Off

Feature Description:
_As a Mission Control Administrator_
_I want to manage users' roles and project visibility_
_So that they have the correct access to projects and Mission Control features_
Rule Title: A user can have System roles
Scenario Title: A user is assigned a System role
Scenario Steps:
Given a user account
And the user is assigned a system role 
Then the user's access to the system will depend on their role

Examples:

| Section        | User        | Admin   |
|:--|:--|:--|
| Administration | Not Visible | Visible |
| Diagnostics    | Not Visible | Visible |

Rule Title: A Workflow must have a plain text name

When the user presses 'Save'
Then an error message is shown: "Name cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters"

And the Workflow is not saved

Rule Title: Workstates can be added to a Workflow
Scenario Title: A new Workstate is added to an existing Workflow
Scenario Steps:
Given a Workflow with the default 'Done' Workstate
When New Workstate is pressed
And the user enters 'In Progress' as Name
When the user presses Save
Then the new Workstate is saved
And the Workstate list contains 2 entries:
  Done

Given a user with a Project Administrator role
And they are viewing the Workflow administration pane
When Add Workflow is pressed
And the user enters 'New Workflow' as the Name
And they press Save
Then the new Workflow is saved
And 'New Workflow' is added to the Workflow list

Scenario Steps:
Given a Workflow which contains the default 'Done' Workstate
When a user edits the Workflow
Then the 'Done' Workstate has no Edit button

Given a Workflow which contains the default 'Done' Workstate

Rule Title: A Workflow can be created

Given a user with an Administrator role

When the user has entered a name
And presses Cancel
Then the Workflow is not saved
And does not appear in the Workflow list

Rule Title: A Workflow can be created

Rule Title: Unused Workflows can be deleted

Scenario Steps:

Rule Title: Unused Workflows can be deleted

Scenario Steps:
Given an assigned Workflow
And an Administrator presses 'Delete'

"[Workflow] is linked to [Project] and cannot be deleted"
And the user presses 'OK'
Then the Workflow is not deleted

Rule Title: Workstates can be ordered within a Workflow
Scenario Title: The order of Work States is changed
Scenario Steps:
Given a Workflow with [CurrentFlow] columns
When a new Workstate is added: In Review
And the Workstates are reordered
Then the Workflow order is [NewOrder]

[CurrentOrder]: Open, In Testing, Done
[NewOrder]: Open, In Review, In Testing, Done

Rule Title: Workstates can be marked as testable
Scenario Title: An Administrator changes a Testable Workstate to Non-Testable
Scenario Steps:
Given a non-default Workstate with a Testable state
And no Work Items are assigned to the Workstate
When an Administrator toggles the Workstate to Non-Testable
And Saves
Then the Workstate is converted to Testable
And [WorkItems] moved to this Workstate appear under [TestState] from Touchdown

Examples

| WorkItems | TestState |
|:--|:--|
| Defect | Known Defect |
| User Story | Not listed |

Rule Title: Workstates can be marked as testable
Scenario Title: An Administrator changes a Non-Testable Workstate to Testable
Scenario Steps:
Given a non-default Workstate with a Non-Testable state
And no Work Items are assigned to the Workstate
When an Administrator toggles the Workstate to Testable
And Saves
Then the Workstate is converted to Testable
And [WorkItems] moved to this Workstate appear under [TestState] from Touchdown

Examples

| WorkItems | TestState |
|:--|:--|
| Defect | Fixed Defect |
| User Story | Acceptance Test Report |

Rule Title: Test results are sent to the server
Scenario Title: A POST command is sent to the server
Scenario Steps:
Given automated test results in an XML file
When the results are posted to the API
Then the test results file is committed to the repository

Results files:  A commit is made stating 'Automatic Test Results added', stating the Sprint and Tag name.

Rule Title: Test results are sent to the server
Scenario Title: A Scenario with existing Automated test results can be updated via the API
Scenario Steps:
Given that a Scenario has an existing failing Automated Test Result
When a passing Test Result is successfully sent to the API
Then the Scenario's results are updated with the passing result
And the result history can be viewed by clicking the Automated Test Results lozenge

Feature Name: Common: Expanding boxes have arrow icon
Rule Title: Linked scenarios on Kanban cards have an arrow icon to expand and collapse fields
Scenario Title: Linked scenarios on Kanban cards have an arrow icon to expand and collapse fields
Scenario Steps:
Given a work item has linked scenarios
When the title with an arrow icon is clicked 
Then the field is expanded
When the title with an arrow icon is clicked
The field is collapsed

Feature Name: Common: Expanding boxes have arrow icon
Rule Title: Tabs within reports have an arrow icon to expand and collapse fields
Scenario Title: Tabs within reports have an arrow icon to expand and collapse fields
Scenario Steps:
Given there has been a completed [Test] test run
And the [Test report] tab is open
When the title with an arrow icon is clicked 
Then the field is expanded
When the title with an arrow icon is clicked
The field is collapsed

Examples:
| [Test] | [Test report] |
| Acceptance test | Acceptance test report |
| Automated test | Automated test report |
| Custom test | Custom test report |

Then the field is expanded
When the title with an arrow icon is clicked
The field is collapsed

Feature Name: Common: Expanding boxes have arrow icon

Scenario Title: The arrow icon to expand and collapse fields only functions when clicking the title
Scenario Steps:
Given a work item has linked scenarios
And at least one field is expanded
When clicking on the body of the scenario
Then the field does not collapse
When clicking on the title with an arrow icon
Then the field collapses

Rule Title: Preview is default view

Then the Rich Text editor is selected by default
And a Save button is displayed

Scenario Steps:
Given that a user is editing text
When they press the Save button
Then the user is returned to Preview
And any changes are saved
And the Edit button is displayed
And the editor tabs are not displayed
And the Save button is not displayed

And the preview tab is clicked

And the text is changed 
And the save button is clicked
Then the text written is displayed when returning to that field

Rule Title: Text fields use RichText which includes a save button

Rule Title: Text fields use RichText so hyper links can be inserted

Rule Title: A user logs in and creates a Work Item
Scenario Title: A user creates a Work Item for a Sprint
Scenario Steps:
Given a [User Role] has logged in
And the selected Sprint is currently open
When the user creates a [Work Item Type]
And all details are valid
And the user saves the Work Item
Then the Work Item card appears at the bottom of the specified lane
And no errors are displayed

Examples: 
[User Role]  User, Administrator
[Work Item Type] User Story, Defect, Task

Scenario Steps:
Given a [User Role] has logged in
And the selected Sprint is currently open
When the user edits an existing [Work Item Type]
And all details are valid
And the user saves the Work Item
Then the updated Work Item card appears in the specified lane
And no errors are displayed

Examples:
[User Role] User, Administrator
[Work Item Type] User Story, Defect, Task

Rule Title: A user logs in and creates a Work Item

Given a [User Role] has logged in
And the selected Sprint is currently open
When the user creates a [Work Item Type]
And all details are valid
And the user saves the Work Item
Then the Work Item card appears at the bottom of the specified lane
And no errors are displayed

[Work Item Type] User Story, Defect, Task

| Field | Original | Edited |
|:--|:--|:--|
| Title | Something Broke | Something is broken |
| Description | That thing done broke | The device stopped working |
| Card Type | User Story | > Defect > Task |
| Sprint | Current | > Next > Current|
| Status |  Default | Assorted |
| Effort | Blank | 10 |

Feature Name: Features (was Blast Off): Completed Sprints displayed as read only
Rule Title: Blast off is a snapshot from time of completion
Scenario Title: A user views Blast Off for a Completed Sprint
Scenario Steps:
Given a user is viewing a project in Blast Off
When the user selects a Completed Sprint
Then a message is displayed:  "The selected sprint has been completed and is read-only"
And [Element] is [State]

| [Element] | [State] |
|:--|:--|
| Search | Active |
| New Feature Group | Inactive |
| New Feature | Inactive |
| Export | Active |
| Feature Groups | Active |
| Feature Group Question | Not Displayed |
| Feature Group Edit | Not Displayed |
| Features | Active |
| Feature Question | Not Displayed |
| Rules | Active |
| New (Rule) | Inactive |
| Rule Question | Not Displayed |
| Rule Edit | Not Displayed |
| Scenarios | Active |
| New (Scenario) | Not Displayed |
| Scenario Question | Not Displayed |
| Scenario Delete | Not Displayed | 
| Scenario Edit | Active |

Feature Name: Features (was Blast Off): Completed Sprints displayed as read only
Rule Title: New and Save buttons are not Enabled
Scenario Title: A user attempts to alter elements within a completed Sprint
Scenario Steps:
Given Blast Off is viewed with a Completed Sprint selected
Then the New Feature Group button is disabled

Feature Description:
_As a User of Blast Off_
_I want to view the history of Blast Off elements_
_So that I can track changes that have happened to elements throughout a project_
Rule Title: Scenario History is displayed within the Scenario
Scenario Title: The Scenario History entries of a Scenario are displayed
Scenario Steps:
Given Scenario "Scenario 1" is displayed in Blast Off
When "Scenario History" is selected within the Edit Scenario modal
Then a list of Scenario History entries is displayed

Feature Description:
_As a User of Blast Off_
_I want to view the history of Blast Off elements_
_So that I can track changes that have happened to elements throughout a project_
Rule Title: Scenario History is displayed within the Scenario
Scenario Title: Old versions of Scenarios can be seen from the Scenario History
Scenario Steps:
Given Scenario "Scenario 1" has the steps "Given, When, Then" and the tag "Tag 1"
When "Scenario 1" is renamed to "Not Scenario 1"
And the steps are edited to be "Then, Given, When"
And the "Tag 1" is removed and Tag "2 Tag" is added
And the Scenario History is viewed
Then the first Scenario History entry shows the Scenario was titled "Scenario 1"
And the steps were "Given, When, Then"
And the tag is "Tag 1"

Scenario Steps:
Given Scenario "Scenario 1" is displayed within Blast Off
When "Scenario 1" is changed to "Not Scenario 1"
And the changes are saved
And the Scenario History for "Not Scenario 1" is viewed
Then there is an entry listed under the user's email with the date and time of when the edit was made

And "Scenario 1" steps are "Given, When, Then"
When the Scenario name is changed to "Not Scenario 2"
And the Scenario's steps are changed to "Then, Given, When"
And the Scenario is not saved
And the most recent Scenario History is displayed
Then the Scenario name is "Scenario 1"
And the steps are "Given, When, Then"

Scenario Steps:
Given Scenario "Scenario 1" is displayed within Blast Off
And there are multiple Scenario History entries
Then they are displayed in chronological order

Feature Description:
_As a User of Blast Off_
_I want to view the history of Blast Off elements_
_So that I can track changes that have happened to elements throughout a project_
Rule Title: Scenario History entries are displayed in chronological order with newest at the top

Feature Description:
_As a User of Blast Off_
_I want to view the history of Blast Off elements_
_So that I can track changes that have happened to elements throughout a project_
Rule Title: Scenario History displays changes to the Scenario title
Scenario Title: The Scenario title is changed and it is recorded in the Scenario History
Scenario Steps:
Given a Scenario with the title "Scenario 1"
And the title is changed to "Not Scenario 2" 
When the Scenario History for "Not Scenario 2" is viewed
Then the most recent entry shows the title as "Scenario 2"
And the entry before shows the title as "Scenario 1"

Feature Description:
_As a User of Blast Off_
_I want to view the history of Blast Off elements_
_So that I can track changes that have happened to elements throughout a project_
Rule Title: Scenario History displays changes to the Scenario steps
Scenario Title: The Scenario steps are changed and it is recorded in the Scenario History
Scenario Steps:
Given the Scenario "Scenario 1" has the steps "Given, When, Then"
And the steps of "Scenario 1" are changed to "Then, Given, When"
When the Scenario History of "Scenario 1" is viewed
Then the most recent entry shows the steps as "Then, Given, When"
And the entry before shows the steps as "Given, When, Then"

Feature Description:
_As a User of Blast Off_
_I want to view the history of Blast Off elements_
_So that I can track changes that have happened to elements throughout a project_
Rule Title: Scenario History displays changes to the Scenario tags
Scenario Title: The Scenario tags are changed and it is recorded in the Scenario History
Scenario Steps:
Given Scenario "Scenario 1" has the tags "Tag 1", "Tag 2" and "Tag 3"
And tags "Tag 1" and "Tag 3" are deleted
When the Scenario History of "Scenario 1" is viewed
Then the most recent entry shows the tags as "Tag 2"
And the entry before shows the tags as "Tag 1", "Tag 2" and "Tag 3"

Feature Description:
_As a User of Blast Off_
_I want to view the history of Blast Off elements_
_So that I can track changes that have happened to elements throughout a project_
Rule Title: Scenario History displays changes to the Scenario linked Work Item
Scenario Title: The Scenario's linked Work Item is changed and it is recorded in the Scenario History
Scenario Steps:
Given Scenario "Scenario 1" has the User Story "Work Item 1" with a known ID linked
And the linked User Story is changed to "Work Item 2" which has a known ID
When the Scenario History of "Scenario 1" is viewed
Then the most recent entry shows the Work Item as the ID of "Work Item 2"
And the entry before shows the Work Item as the ID of "Work Item 1"

And scenario 'Scenario 1' also exists

Rule Title: A folder can be created
Scenario Title: A folder name must only contain alphanumeric characters
Scenario Steps:
Given a user viewing the New Folder modal window
And the Name field contains non-alphanumeric characters

Then an error message is displayed
And the folder is not saved

Example:
Folder name: My-folder
Error message: "New Directory name can only include letters, digits and spaces"

Rule Title: A folder can be created

Given a user is viewing the New Folder modal window
And they have entered a valid folder name
When the user presses Save
Then a new folder is created within Briefing's documentation section

Rule Title: A folder can be created

Scenario Steps:

And viewing the Documentation pane
When a user selects 'Folder' from the New drop-down menu
Then the New Directory modal is displayed

Rule Title: A folder can be created
Scenario Title: A Sub-folder can be created
Scenario Steps:
Given a user within [FolderTree]
When they save a new Folder called [NewFolder]
Then the new Folder is found at [TreePath]

Examples:

| FolderTree | New Folder | TreePath | 
|:--|:--|:--|
|  /Documentation | New Folder | /Documentation/New Folder |
| /Documentation/Development | New Folder | /Documentation/Development/New Folder |

Rule Title: A folder can be created

Then an error message is displayed: "Folder name cannot be empty"

Rule Title: A document can be created

| 1 | Sprint 1 |
| 2 | Sprint 2 |
| 3 | Sprint 3 |

Rule Title: The default document displayed is README.md
Scenario Title: The default document is displayed when viewing Documentation
Scenario Steps:
Given an Administrator creates a new project
When Briefing is viewed
Then there is a Documentation folder
And the folder contains a README.md file
And the file contains "# [ProjectName]"

Rule Title: Documents are displayed as formatted Github-flavoured Markdown
Scenario Title: A document containing markdown is displayed as formatted HTML
Scenario Steps:
Given a markdown document is added to a Project's Documentation folder
And the document contains the following [markdownElement]
When the document is viewed via Briefing
Then the document is rendered as HTML

| markdownElement | Notes |
|:--|:--|
| Headers | H1-6 |
| Emphasis | bold, italics and strikethrough |
| Lists | Ordered and unordered |
| Links | |
| Images | |
| Code and Syntax Highlighting | code blocks, unsure that markdown supports syntax highlights? Single line was rendered as a code tag, multi-lines as a pre tag |
| Tables | Works, with alignments too |
| Blockquotes | Rendered as pre tags |
| Inline HTML | tested a plain text sentence with bold tags |
| Horizontal Rule | |
| Line Breaks | with HTML breaks |
| Plain text | |

Rule Title: All markdown documents within the Documentation folder and sub folders can be displayed
Scenario Title: Only documents with .md extension are displayed
Scenario Steps:
Given a Project Documentation folder
And the following files are present: ReadMe.txt, ReadMe.md
When a user views the Project's Briefing
Then ReadMe.md is listed under Documentation
And ReadMe.txt is not visible

Rule Title: All markdown documents within the Documentation folder and sub folders can be displayed
Scenario Title: Documents within sub folders are displayed
Scenario Steps:
Given a Project Documentation folder
When a sub folder is added: 'SubFolder'
And ReadMe.md is added to 'SubFolder'
Then the Documentation structure contains a sub folder: SubFolder
And 'SubFolder' has ReadMe.md present

Rule Title: Documents and folders are alphabetically ordered (ascending)

Rule Title: A checklist of tasks on a work item card has a checkbox which can be selected or unselected

Feature Description:
As a user,
I want completed Sprints to be read only, 
So history cannot be changed and there is a consistent truth to the work completed
Rule Title: No New Button Available
Scenario Title: A Completed Sprint cannot have new Work Items added
Scenario Steps:
Given a user viewing Mission for a Completed Sprint
Then a message is displayed: "The selected sprint has been completed and is read-only"
And the New (Work Item) button is not displayed

Feature Description:
As a user,
I want completed Sprints to be read only, 
So history cannot be changed and there is a consistent truth to the work completed
Rule Title: No Elements within a card are changeable
Scenario Title: A Work Item within a Completed Sprint is edited
Scenario Steps:
Given a user clicks on a Work Item within a Completed Sprint
Then [Element] is [State]

| [Element] | [State] |
|:--|:--|
| Details (tab) | Active |
| Title | Read-only |
| Card Type | Read-only |
| Sprint | Read-only |
| Tags (Existing) | Read-only |
| Tags (field) | Read-only |
| Status | Read-only |
| Description | Read-only |
| Effort | Read-only |
| Save | Inactive |
| Cancel | Active |
| Delete | Inactive |
| Linked Scenarios (tab) | Active |
| Scenarios (toggle) | Active |
| Scenario Result: Not Run | Active |
| Scenario Result: Pass | Active |
| Scenario Result: Fail | Active |
| Scenario Result: Inconclusive | Active |
| Comments (tab) | Active |
| Comments: text field | Read-only |
| Comments: Post | Inactive |
| Attachments (tab) | Active |
| Attachments: Choose file button | Inactive |
| Attached files: Delete | Inactive | 
| Attached files: Download | Active |

Feature Description:
As a user,
I want completed Sprints to be read only, 
So history cannot be changed and there is a consistent truth to the work completed
Rule Title: Attachments are still downloadable
Scenario Title: Files can be downloaded from a Work Item within a Completed Sprint
Scenario Steps:
Given a Work Item with attached files
And the Sprint has been completed
When a user views the Attachments tab
And presses the Download icon
Then the attached file is downloaded to the user's computer

Feature Description:
_As a tester_
_I want to manage Scenarios linked to Work Items in Kanban_
_So that I can understand the requirements for the Work Item_
Rule Title: A Linked Scenario can be edited
Scenario Title: A Linked Scenario name is changed
Scenario Steps:
Given I am viewing Mission
And there is a [work item] with a title of "Work Item 1"
And the [work item] is linked to Scenario "Scenatio1"
And "Scenario 1" has the Steps "Given, When, Then" 
When you edit the "Scenario 1" from within Mission
And the title is changed to "Not Scenario 2"
And the Steps are changed to "When, Then, Given"
And the save button is pressed
Then the linked Scenario title is now "Not Scenario 2"
And "Not Scenario 2" has the Steps "When, Then, Given"

[work item] User Story, Defect
Work Item Title: [Mission] Navigate to a Scenario from a Linked Scenario

Feature Description:
_As a tester_
_I want to manage Scenarios linked to Work Items in Kanban_

Feature Name: Kanban (was Mission): PR status is displayed on Kanban cards
Rule Title: The PR number for a Kanban card can be selected from a drop down menu
Scenario Title: The PR number for a Kanban card can be selected from a drop down menu
Scenario Steps:
Given a work item card has been completed
And a PR for the tasks has been created
When the 'PR Status' drop down menu is selected
Then a list of available PR numbers can be selected
Work Item Title: As a Developer, I want to see if my PR has been reviewed

Feature Name: Kanban (was Mission): PR status is displayed on Kanban cards
Rule Title: When a PR number for a Kanban card has been entered, the status of the PR is displayed as a badge on the card
Scenario Title: When a PR number for a Kanban card has been entered, the status of the PR is displayed as a badge on the card
Scenario Steps:
Given a work item card has a PR number assigned
And the status of the PR is [PR Status]
When the Kanban board is viewed
Then there is a badge with the PR status [PR Status]

Examples:
| [PR Status] |
| Approved |
| Review Required |
| Changes Requested |
Work Item Title: As a Developer, I want to see if my PR has been reviewed

Feature Name: Kanban (was Mission): PR status is displayed on Kanban cards
Rule Title: The PR status is updated when the Kanban board is loaded or refreshed
Scenario Title: The PR status is updated when the Kanban board is loaded or refreshed
Scenario Steps:
Given a work item card has a PR number assigned to it
And there is a badge on the card with the PR status 'Review Required' displayed
When the status of the PR is 'Approved'
And the Kanban board is refreshed
Then there is a badge with the PR status 'Approved' displayed
Work Item Title: As a Developer, I want to see if my PR has been reviewed

Feature Name: Kanban (was Mission): PR status is displayed on Kanban cards
Rule Title: To enable PR's to be tracked the Git Address can be added to the project
Scenario Title: To enable PR's to be tracked the Git Address can be added to the project
Scenario Steps:
Given a User has Administration rights
And an existing project has been set up
When the 'Projects' tab has been selected
And the 'Edit' button is selected
Then a pop up box is displayed in which the Github Address can be entered
Work Item Title: As a Developer, I want to see if my PR has been reviewed

Feature Description:

Scenario Steps:
Given I am viewing Mission
When "Test Project"  is selected
And "Sprint 1" is selected
Then I can see 6 columns with the names "Open", "Planned", "In Progress", "For Review", "In Testing" and "Done"

Given I am viewing Mission

When the work item is clicked and dragged to the "Planned" column
Then "Work Item 1" is displayed in the "Planned" column

Feature Description:

Scenario Title: A work item can be moved to a specific position in the next column
Scenario Steps:
Given Mission is displayed with a User Story at the top of the "Open" column
And a Defect at the top of the "Planned" column
And a Task at the top of the "In Progress" column
When the [work item] is dragged to [position]
Then the [work item] is displayed at [position]

|[work item]|[position]|
|:--|:--|
|User Story|the top of "Planned"|
|User Story|the bottom of "Planned"|
|User Story|the top of "In Progress"|
|User Story|the bottom of "In Progress"|
|Defect|the top of  "Open"|
|Defect|the bottom of "Open"|
|Defect|the top of "In Progress"|
|Defect|the bottom of "In Progress"|
|Task|the top of "Planned"|
|Task|the bottom of "Planned"|

|Task|the bottom of "Planned'|

Feature Description:

_So that I can plan what is done and see Sprint progress_
Rule Title: Work Items can be moved to specific locations in other columns different columns
Scenario Title: A user attempts to drag a Work Item across multiple Workstates
Scenario Steps:
Given a user is viewing an uncompleted Sprint Kanban
And the Workflow has multiple Workstates
And the Work Item is currently in the first Workstate
And the Work Item has [DoDState] Defintions of Done 
When the user attempts to drag the Work Item to the third Work State
Then an error message is shown: "Work Items must be moved one lane at a time"
And the Work Item remains in the first Workstate
Work Item Title: [Checklist behaviour] Progressing a Work Item across multiple lanes displays an incorrect error message

Then the Work Item is moved to "In Progress"

Rule Title: Mid-sprint results can be seen on linked Work Items
Scenario Title: A Work Item with a single linked Scenario is given a mid-sprint result
Scenario Steps:
Given a Work Item which has only one linked Scenario
When a [Result] is added to the linked Scenario
Then the Work Item will carry a [Badge] when viewed in Mission

Examples:

| Result | Badge |
|:--|:--|
| Passed | Green |
| Failed | Red |
| Inconclusive | Amber |
| Not Run | Grey |
| No Result | Grey |
Work Item Title: [Mission] Display Not Run badge on card if linked scenarios exist

Feature Description:
_As a developer_
_I want to move Sprint Work Items_
_So that I can plan what is done and see Sprint progress_
Rule Title: Mid-sprint results can be seen on linked Work Items
Scenario Title: A Work Item has multiple linked Scenarios
Scenario Steps:
Given a Work Item with 2 or more linked Scenarios
When one or more [Results] are added to the linked Scenarios
Then a Badge indicating an overall [Status] is displayed in Mission

Examples:

| Results | Status |
|:--|:--|
| Not Run, Not Run | Grey |
| Not Run, Fail | Red |
| Not Run, Pass | Grey |
| No Result, Pass | Grey |
| Inconclusive, Pass | Amber |
| Pass, Fail | Red |
| Pass, Pass | Green |
| Inconclusive, Inconclusive | Grey, Grey |
| Fail, Fail | Red |
Work Item Title: [Mission] Display Not Run badge on card if linked scenarios exist

Feature Description:
_As a Mission User_

_So that communication about work can stay within Mission Control and not get lost_
Rule Title: Comments are displayed within the Edit Work Item modal with user and date/time

Given the Edit Work Item modal is displayed for a [work item]
And the Comments tab is displayed
When the text "This is a comment" is added into the text box
And the Post button is pressed
Then the comment is appended beneath the text box
And elements are displayed in the following order: 
  User's email address
  Comment text
  "Posted: ", date, time

Feature Name: Reports (was Touchdown): Acceptance Test Report for Sprint
Feature Description:
_As a project Stakeholder_
_I want to see the results of all the acceptance tests for a Sprint_
_So that I have increased confidence that the work undertaken has provided value_
Rule Title: The report includes test results
Scenario Title: No report displayed when no sprint test run exists
Scenario Steps:
Given there are no cards are in the "Done" column in Mission
And "New" is pressed on Re-entry
When Touchdown is viewed
Then only the test report title is shown
And no test results are displayed
Work Item Title: [Touchdown] Display Acceptance Test Report for Selected Sprint

Feature Name: Reports (was Touchdown): Acceptance Test Report for Sprint

And scenario 1 is displayed under rule 1 and feature 2 is displayed as "Passed"

Rule Title: Completing a Sprint requires confirmation
Scenario Title: A Sprint is Completed
Scenario Steps:
Given a Uncomplete Sprint where the Touchdown Report has been Published
And an Administrator presses Complete
And a modal window is displayed
"""
Please type "yes" if you are sure you want to continue with completing a sprint
"""
When the Administrator types: "yes"
And clicks Complete
Then the Sprint is marked as Complete

Rule Title: Only Administrators can Complete a Sprint
Scenario Title: An Administrator Completes a Sprint
Scenario Steps:
Given a Sprint Report has been Published
And the Sprint has not been Completed
When an Administrator views Touchdown
Then a Complete button is displayed

Rule Title: Only Administrators can Complete a Sprint
Scenario Title: A User attempts to Complete a Sprint
Scenario Steps:
Given a Sprint Report has been Published
And the Sprint has not been Completed
When a User views Touchdown
Then a Complete button is not displayed

Rule Title: A Sprint can only be Completed if all Work Items are in the Done column
Scenario Title: A Sprint is completed with all Work Items in the Done column
Scenario Steps:
Given a Sprint with one or more Work Items
And all Work Items are in the Done Work State
And the Report has been published
When an Administrator presses 'Complete'
Then the Sprint Completion modal is displayed
Work Item Title: [Touchdown] Do not allow sprint to be completed if uncompleted cards exist

Rule Title: A Sprint can only be Completed if all Work Items are in the Done column
Scenario Title: A Sprint is completed with all Work Items in the Done column
Scenario Steps:
Given a Sprint with one or more Work Items
And all Work Items are in the Done Work State
And the Report has been published
When an Administrator presses 'Complete'
Then the Sprint Completion modal is displayed
Work Item Title: Sprint cannot be completed if there are cards outside of the 'Done' column

Rule Title: A Sprint can only be Completed if all Work Items are in the Done column
Scenario Title: Work Items outside of the Done column
Scenario Steps:
Given a Sprint with one or more Work Items
And any Work Items are present outside of the Done Work State
And the Report has been published
When an Administrator presses 'Complete'
Then an Information modal is displayed with the following text:
"""
Information
The Sprint can not be completed until all Work Items are moved to Done or a future Sprint
"""
Work Item Title: [Touchdown] Do not allow sprint to be completed if uncompleted cards exist

Rule Title: A Sprint can only be Completed if all Work Items are in the Done column

Feature Description:

Rule Title: Fixed Defects for a Sprint are displayed in a tab in Touchdown

And "Defect 3" is the newest

And "Defect 1" is shown at the bottom of the list of fixed Defects

Rule Title: Stakeholder activity on Sprint Achievements, Acceptance Test Report, Sprint Feedback, Known Defects, Fixed Defects tabs can be viewed in the Activity tab
Scenario Title: A Stakeholder has visited an area in Touchdown
Scenario Steps:
Given a Stakeholder is logged into Mission Control
And the Stakeholder views [Area] within Touchdown 
When an administrator views the Activity tab in Touchdown
Then the latest entry shows the page, user role, date/time and Sprint of the visit made by the Stakeholder

|Area|
|:--|
| Sprint Achievements |
| Acceptance Test Report |
| Sprint Feedback |
| Known Defects |
| Fixed Defects |

And all Defects appear as Known Defects

| user |

| Administrator |
| User |

Rule Title: Unit test changes are reported
Scenario Title: Unit tests are added
Scenario Steps:
Given a list of unit tests from the latest tagged build
And a list of the previous tagged build's unit tests
When a unit test has been added to the latest build
Then the report contains only the newly added unit test
Work Item Title: [Reports] Show list of unit tests added in a sprint

Rule Title: Unit test changes are reported
Scenario Title: Unit tests are updated
Scenario Steps:
Given a list of unit tests from the latest tagged build
And a list of the previous tagged build's unit tests
When a unit test has been altered in the latest build
Then the report contains only the altered unit test
Work Item Title: [Reports] Show list of unit tests added in a sprint

Rule Title: Unit test changes are reported
Scenario Title: Unit tests are removed
Scenario Steps:
Given a list of unit tests from the latest tagged build
And a list of the previous tagged build's unit tests
When a unit test has been removed from the latest build
Then the report contains only the removed unit test
Work Item Title: [Reports] Show list of unit tests added in a sprint

Feature Name: Roadmap (was Launchpad): Earmark Sprints for further work on Features
Feature Description:
_As a Product Owner_
_I want to earmark sprints for further work on Features_
_So that I can plan my product's evolution_
Rule Title: A Roadmap Entry can be created for the current Sprint
Scenario Title: Work is earmarked for a current Sprint
Scenario Steps:
Given a user clicked an empty (white) Timeline Entry for the current sprint
When the 'Earmark work for [Current Sprint]' is option is checked
And the Edit Roadmap Modal changes are saved
Then the Feature's Timeline Entry for the current sprint is coloured Amber

Feature Name: Roadmap (was Launchpad): Earmark Sprints for further work on Features
Feature Description:
_As a Product Owner_
_I want to earmark sprints for further work on Features_
_So that I can plan my product's evolution_
Rule Title: A Roadmap Entry can be created for the current Sprint
Scenario Title: Work is no longer earmarked for the current Sprint
Scenario Steps:
Given a user clicked an Earmarked (Amber) Timeline Entry for the current sprint
And there are no Activity Badges
When the 'Earmark work for [Current Sprint]' is option is unchecked
And the Edit Roadmap Modal changes are saved
Then the Feature's Timeline Entry for the current sprint is coloured White

Feature Name: Roadmap (was Launchpad): Earmark Sprints for further work on Features

Rule Title: Test Runs can be created for the selected Sprint
Scenario Title: The current Sprint is selected
Scenario Steps:
Given Jack is viewing Re-entry
And "Sprint 2" is the current Sprint
And "Sprint 2" has 3 Scenarios linked to 3 User Stories in the "Done" column
And "Sprint 1" has 3 Scenarios linked to 3 User Stories in the "Done" column
And no Test Run for "Sprint 2" exists
When the "New" button is pressed
Then the Test Run is only populated with the 3 Scenarios from "Sprint 2"
Work Item Title: [Re-entry] Create test run for selected Sprint

Rule Title: Test Runs can be created for the selected Sprint
Scenario Title: A finished Sprint is selected
Scenario Steps:
Given Jack is viewing Re-entry
And "Sprint 2" is the current Sprint
And "Sprint 1" has finished
And "Sprint 2" has 3 Scenarios linked to 3 User Stories in the "Done" column
And "Sprint 1" has 3 Scenarios linked to 3 User Stories in the "Done" column
And no Test Run for "Sprint 1" exists
When a Test Run for "Sprint 1" is created
Then the Test Run is only populated with the 3 Scenarios from "Sprint 1"
Work Item Title: [Re-entry] Create test run for selected Sprint

Rule Title: Test Runs can be created for the selected Sprint
Scenario Title: A future Sprint is selected
Scenario Steps:
Given Jack is viewing Re-entry
And "Sprint 2" is the current Sprint
And "Sprint 3" is a future Sprint
And "Sprint 2" has 3 Scenarios linked to 3 User Stories in the "Done" column
And "Sprint 3" has 3 Scenarios linked to 3 User Stories in the "Done" column
And no Test Run for "Sprint 3" exists
When a Test Run for "Sprint 3" is created
Then the Test Run is only populated with the 3 Scenarios from "Sprint 3"
Work Item Title: [Re-entry] Create test run for selected Sprint

Rule Title: A Test Plan can be updated with changes made in Blast Off

Scenario Steps:
Given an Acceptance Test report has been generated for a Sprint

When a user presses Update button from Re-entry
Then the changed Scenario is updated in the report
Work Item Title: [Re-entry] Add Update button in Re-entry to update test plan

Rule Title: Test Plan updates retain comments and test result
Scenario Title: The Scenario title and steps have changed in Blast Off for a test that has been run with comments
Scenario Steps:
Given an Acceptance Test Plan Scenario with a result
And a comment has been added: "I am a comment"
And a user updates the Scenario Details via Blast Off
When the Acceptance Test Plan is updated
Then the Scenario Details are updated
And the Scenario's result is unchanged
And the comment is unchanged
Work Item Title: [Re-entry] Add Update button in Re-entry to update test plan

Rule Title: New Test Runs have no results
Scenario Title: A Test Run is created from cards with mid sprint test results
Scenario Steps:
Given an open Sprint
And there are Work Items with Linked Scenarios
And the Linked Scenarios contain one, or more, mid-sprint results
When a new [Test Run] is created
Then all Linked Scenarios for the selected Sprint are listed
And no results are given for the listed Scenarios

[Test Run]: Acceptance Test Run, Custom Test Run

Rule Title: New Test Runs have no results

Given an open Sprint
And there are Work Items with Linked Scenarios
And the Linked Scenarios do not have any mid-sprint results
When a new [Test Run] is created
Then all Linked Scenarios for the selected Sprint are listed
And no results are given for the listed Scenarios

[Test Run]: Acceptance Test Run, Custom Test Run

Rule Title: Acceptance Test Plans can be run if the editable box is left blank

| Tab | Element | Status |
|:--|:--|:--|
| Acceptance Testing | Update Button | Not displayed |
| | New Button | Not displayed |
| | Test Results | Inactive |
| Custom Testing | Test Run Selection List | Active |
| | New Custom List | Not displayed |
| Sprint Achievements | Notes field | Read-only |
| | Save | Not displayed |

Rule Title: Sprint achievements are not editable

And the Post button is non displayed

Feature Name: Testing (was Re-entry): Perform a Test Plan Run
Feature Description:
_As a tester_
_I want to perform a test plan run_
_So that I can increase confidence that we have delivered value in a sprint_
Rule Title: Each test can be passed or failed
Scenario Title: Passing a scenario
Scenario Steps:
Given there is a scenario "I am a scenario" linked to work item "Work item 1"
And a test run has been created
And scenario "I am a scenario" is Untested
Then scenario "I am a scenario" can be set to Passed 
And reloading the page "I am a scenario" is still set to Passed

And the current Sprint is "Sprint 2"
And "Sprint 1" has finished
And "Sprint 2" has 3 Scenarios linked to 3 User Stories in the "Done" column
And "Sprint 1" has 3 Scenarios linked to 3 User Stories in the "Done" column
And no Test Run for "Sprint 1" exists
When a Test Run for "Sprint 1" is created
Then the Test Run is only populated with the 3 Scenarios from "Sprint 1"

Then the author is displayed as "jack.skerrett@bluefruit.co.uk"

Feature Name: User Needs: The system allows an Administrator to complete a Sprint
Feature Description:
As a Mission Control Administrator 
I want to be able to complete an open Sprint once I have Stakeholder approval
So that I can ensure that no further changes can be made to the Sprint
Rule Title: A Sprint must be Published before being Completed
